last_episode_to_air.name: Rescue Ranch Remodel
last_episode_to_air.overview: Gentle Barn is home to more than 200 rescued animals, including sheep, cows, pigs, horses, a llama and even an emu. Antonio is on the scene to design a stunning build to get all those rescues active and moving.

name: Animal Cribs
overview: Antonio Ballatore, his project manager Grace, and his right hand-dog, Chewie the bulldog, along with a team of Catsperts and Barkitects, transform drab, cramped homes and outside areas into functional, high-style spaces for both pets and the people they love. Antonio's excitement for both design and animals drive him to go the extra mile for his clients and their four-legged, winged, and scaly friends. The newly designed spaces, renovated specifically for the homeowners and their pets, feature design elements that alter homes to become creative and purposeful spaces for all to enjoy. This season, viewers will see a cabin redesign for a family and their blind dog; a complete backyard renovation featuring a pet-safe fire-pit; a man-cave that can accommodate 20 pets; and a room design complete with a soaring sculptural cat climbing wall, among other design transformations.

episodes.name: Tricked Out Cat Castle
episodes.overview: A mother and daughter create a cats-only tree house connected by a suspension bridge for an energetic indoor cat

episodes.name: A Backyard to Drool For
episodes.overview: Antonio and team transform a health-hazard yard into a dog-friendly escape, complete with paw-operated drinking fountain and medicinal plants. Inside, a bathroom is transformed into a dog wash, and a drool-proof feeding station solves a sticky problem.

episodes.name: Ultimate Manimal Cave
episodes.overview: A cluttered basement housing more than 20 rescued reptiles, mammals and birds is transformed into an underground grotto featuring artificial rock walls for the residents and an entertainment space everyone can use.

episodes.name: Condo Cat Creation
episodes.overview: A cramped condo with two cats and a rescue dog is renovated so the pets have personalized spaces built into the stairs and furniture, and there's even a 20-foot cat-climbing wall.

episodes.name: Football Pup Palace
episodes.overview: Turf, the "wildlife control officer" for the Seahawks, is a working dog with messy habits. Antonio Ballatore helps Turf's owners create a doggy spa and transforms the lackluster backyard into a football-themed doggy paradise.

episodes.name: Senior Dog's Decked Out Dorm
episodes.overview: Antonio and the team make a mountain cabin safe and build a Japanese-inspired lounge for a blind dog.

episodes.name: Superfly Parrot Palace
episodes.overview: Antonio Ballatore builds a huge geodesic dome to give some colorful rescue birds space to spread their wings and helps a family to reclaim their kitchen and dining room.

episodes.name: Ultimate Builds
episodes.overview: Designer Antonio Ballatore showcases incredible pet-centric builds that have inspired his own creations.

episodes.name: Fluffy Fixer Pupper
episodes.overview: A family needs help creating a multi-functional space for their bunnies, ferrets, cats and dogs. Antonio designs elaborate hatches, ramps and tunnels that allow the animals to be in the same room but remain safely separated.

episodes.name: Dog Town, USA
episodes.overview: Antonio helps a family who opened their home to neighborhood dogs create the ultimate backyard dog park with custom dog houses, a paddling pool for hot days and a slick structure of ramps and tunnels to keep everyone entertained.

episodes.name: Chinchilla Chill Pad
episodes.overview: Antonio and his team design and build an elaborate system of tunnels and towers spanning two rooms for a family and their seven adorable, fluffy chinchillas.

episodes.name: Backyard Barnyard
episodes.overview: A family has been crowded out by their animals, including two mini horses that insist on sleeping in the master bedroom. Antonio's solution is to build a horse barn with all the modern comforts and attach it directly to the house.

episodes.name: Cat Build Gone Wild
episodes.overview: A couple wants their savannah cat and foster kittens to safely enjoy the outdoors. Antonio's solution is a system of outdoor catwalks and enclosures with cat-friendly plants, natural climbing surfaces and all the toys a cat needs.

episodes.name: Pygmy Goat Playground
episodes.overview: A family has two Nigerian dwarf goats who wreak havoc in their backyard. Antonio transforms their space into the ultimate goat playground, with a climbing tower, observation deck and an easy-to-clean three-story goat house.

episodes.name: Subterranean Paradise
episodes.overview: A firefighter who rescued a 20-foot Burmese python from a burning building needs Antonio's help. In one of his most ambitious projects, Antonio transforms the basement into an epic habitat with heated rock facades, a waterfall and pond.

episodes.name: Pot-Bellied Pig Palace
episodes.overview: Antonio meets a family and their pot-bellied pig, who has ruined their front yard. Antonio designs the ultimate piggy paradise with a new pig house, mud pit, space to run and an activity wall to keep Mr. Pickles happy.

episodes.name: Bunny Beach Bungalow
episodes.overview: Antonio meets a couple whose home has been taken over by their rescued bunnies. He transforms their overgrown backyard into a beach-themed oasis for humans and bunnies, complete with predator-proof enclosures.

episodes.name: Dragons' Den
episodes.overview: Antonio meets a family with two bearded dragons that are stuck in a tank in mom's bedroom. He designs a temperature-controlled dragon clubhouse with self-sustaining tanks, a climbing area and a cool hangout spot for the family.

episodes.name: Rescue Ranch Remodel
episodes.overview: Gentle Barn is home to more than 200 rescued animals, including sheep, cows, pigs, horses, a llama and even an emu. Antonio is on the scene to design a stunning build to get all those rescues active and moving.
